question: 今すぐ
sourceMnemonic: You'll have to learn this word in two parts. You already know the meaning of <ja>今</ja> because of the kanji, which means "now." The <ja>すぐ</ja> part, however, is a new word, meaning "soon." <ja>すぐ</ja> and "soon" even start with a similar sound, so maybe that can help you remember this! If you put <ja>今</ja> and <ja>すぐ</ja> together, you get "now soon." Put in better English, that's <vocabulary>at once</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>right now</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since you already know the vocab word <ja>今</ja> (read <ja>いま</ja>), you should be able to read this word as well.
